Choose File→New→New Business Modeler IDE Template Project.
In the New Business Modeler IDE Template Project dialog box, set the following, and click Finish.
Prefix
Must be between two and four characters. The first character must be an uppercase letter. For example, A1.
Template name
Must include the prefix followed by a name. For example, a1test.
Template display name, Template description
Enter the name and description to display.
Dependent templates directory
Use the default location, [Teamcenter install directory]\TC_ROOT\bmide\templates.
Teamcenter creates the new project and expands the BMIDE folders to display the objects.
Click Find Element.
In the Find BMIDE Element dialog box, type ugcam.
The element list displays the CAM elements:UGCAMCLSF, UGCAMPTP, UGCAMShopDoc, and UGCAMTemplateData.
Select UGCAMPTP and click OK.
This element contains the post processing source (PTP) file.
On the BMIDE tab, double-click the UGCAMPTP element.
On the UGCAMPTP tab, click the References tab.
Tip:
If you don't see the References tab, click >> to select it.
Click Add.
In the Add Dataset Reference dialog box, in the Reference box, append LPT to the dataset prefix.
For example, if the prefix is A1, the Reference entry is A1LPT.
In the FileType box, type *.lpt.
From the Format list, select Text, and click Finish.
Teamcenter adds A1LPT to the References list.
In the References list, select A1LPT.
Click the Tool Actions tab.
The Tool Actions list displays the following actions:
Open
OpenUsing
Print
PrintUsing
Add the LPT reference to each action.
Select Open, and click Edit.
In the Dataset Tool Action Definition dialog box, under References, click Add.
In the Add Reference dialog box, select the Export check box.
Note:
The selected reference, A1LPT, displays in the Select the Reference Name box.
Click Finish.
In the Dataset Tool Action Definition dialog box, Teamcenter adds A1LPT to the References list.
In the Dataset Tool Action Definition dialog box, click Finish.
Repeat steps a through e for each action.
Click Save Data Model.
In the Save Data Model dialog box, make sure that the project check box is selected, and click OK.
For this example, A1
Deploy this data model change as you would any other change per your site practice.

Document Title: Edit TC preference to add the root_activity value
Document Body:
Edit the standard MEOPRevision_DefaultChildProperties TC preference to add the “root_activity” value.
Note: you must be the admin to do this procedure.
In Teamcenter, choose Edit→Options.
Click the Search tab.
in the Options dialog box, in the Preferences List group, in the Search On Keywords box, enter MEOPRevision.
In the list, select MEOPRevision_DefaultChildProperties
Under Values, click Edit .
In the input box, enter root_activity, and click Add Value .
Click Save .
This procedure activates the View folder when you store your jobs in NX, and you can see the imported code file, and the postfiles inside teamcenter.

What is it?
Teamcenter supports managing and distributing postprocessors. To use only Teamcenter postprocessors in NX, you must select the Use Postprocessors and ISV Drivers from Teamcenter customer default.
The postprocessors from Teamcenter are loaded into a specified temporary directory when you open a part file in NX.
Where do I find it?
Product
NX
Application
Manufacturing
Prerequisite
The Teamcenter administrator must first import the postprocessing files and ISV drivers into the Teamcenter database, or you will get an error.
Menu
File→Utilities→Customer Defaults
Location in dialog box
Manufacturing→Output→Postprocessing tab→Teamcenter Integration group→Use Postprocessors and ISV Drivers from Teamcenter/Temporary Directory

Document Title: Suppressing Teamcenter Login dialog box when SSO is active
Document Body:
You can set environment variables to suppress the Teamcenter Login dialog box when single sign-on (SSO) is active. This lets you access the Manufacturing Resource Library (MRL) from native NX without logging on to Teamcenter again.
Environment variable
Valid settings
UGII_CAM_MRL_CONNECT_HIDE_LOGIN_DIALOG

Set to TRUE or true to hide the Teamcenter Login dialog box.
Set to FALSE or false to display the Teamcenter Login dialog box.
The Teamcenter Login dialog box is also displayed if the environment variable is not defined.
UGII_CAM_MRL_CONNECT_GROUP 

Set to a valid Teamcenter group name.
Requires that UGII_CAM_MRL_CONNECT_HIDE_LOGIN_DIALOG is set to TRUE or true.
UGII_CAM_MRL_CONNECT_ROLE 

Set to a valid Teamcenter role name.
Requires that UGII_CAM_MRL_CONNECT_HIDE_LOGIN_DIALOG is set to TRUE or true.
Where do I find it?
Application
Manufacturing

Document Title: Device and tool ID information in Teamcenter
Document Body:
The following MOM variables control the transfer of device and tool ID information to Teamcenter:
mom_device_path
mom_device_path_ids
mom_tool_id
In Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, the Activities tab displays the MOM variable content in columns. You can configure which user attributes and which MOM variables to display in the columns.
For information on how to enable user variables and display MOM variables in Teamcenter, see Synchronize NX CAM to Teamcenter custom user tooling data in the Managing Manufacturing Data document.
mom_device_path
The Device Path column displays the mounting path for tools when mom_device_path is active.
For each device in the mounting path for a tool, the NX CAM name displays in a comma-separated list. This lets you see, in Teamcenter, the NX names for the devices in which the tool instance is mounted. The device information also tells shop floor personnel how to mount tools correctly.
Example:
Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, Activities tab
Line
Device Path
Description
1
NXT_DRILL_11_00003_A
MACH_POCKET, SPINDLE
SPOT_DRILL
2
NXT_MILL_13_00026_A
HEAD_POCKET_1, BENZ_ANGLE_HEAD, MACH_POCKET, SPINDLE
FLOOR_FACING

The Device Path column lets you see if tool orientation information is included in the NX name for a device.
Example:
Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, Activities tab
Line
Device Path
UGT0111_001
R_POCKET_1,DUO_TURN_TOOLHOLDER,POCKET_05
mom_device_path_ids
The Device Path IDs column displays the mounting path for tools when mom_device_path_ids is active.
In this column, the Teamcenter item and revision ID for each device in the mounting path for a tool displays in a comma-separated list. The Teamcenter item IDs are in double quotes to indicate the information comes from Teamcenter. If a device is not stored in Teamcenter, the NX name is displayed. In the following example, only the angle head is stored in Teamcenter.
Example:
Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, Activities tab
Line
Device Path IDs
Description
1
NXT_DRILL_11_00003_A
MACH_POCKET, SPINDLE
SPOT_DRILL
2
NXT_MILL_13_00026_A
HEAD_POCKET_1, "BENZ_WFK_HSK63/A", MACH_POCKET, SPINDLE
FLOOR_FACING
mom_tool_id
The Tool ID column displays the item revision ID for tools when mom_tool_id is active. Displaying the item revision ID helps you to identify the multi-tool item in the BOM that belongs to an activity line. The following example is for a multi-tool that has two occurrences in the BOM.
Example:
Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, BOM view, CAM setup tab
BOM Line
nxt_multi_10_1000/A;1-3 Turning Cutters (View)
tc_holder_25_20_100_1000/A'1=HSK63A_ASHR_20_135 (VIEW)
tc_turn_10_10_100_1030/A;1-OD Turning VKT 20, Insert
tc_turn_10_20_100_1010/A;1-OD Turning VKT 20, Insert

Teamcenter Manufacturing Process Planner, Activities tab
Line
Tool ID
Description
NXT_MULTI_10_1000_A-C1
nxt_multi_10_1000/A
ROUGH_TURN_OD1
NXT_MULTI_10_1000_A-C2
nxt_multi_10_1000/A

Document Title: Correct version of Manufacturing templates loaded for NX sessions
Document Body:
What is it?
Teamcenter supports multiple versions of the NX Manufacturing templates in a single database. The administrator for your Teamcenter installation imports the Manufacturing templates for each release. After you set the template preference in Teamcenter, the correct Manufacturing templates for your NX version are loaded.
NX75 CAM Setup Templates
machining_knowledge_metric_NX75
MillTurn_Express_metric_NX75
DieMold_Express_metric_NX75
turning_metric_NX75
MillTurn_Express_target_metric_NX75
mold_sequences_metric_NX75
Version specific CAM templates in Teamcenter
Release
Teamcenter preference string
NX 7.5
Includes Manufacturing PAX file support.
TC_NX_FileNewPAXFiles_NX75
For more information on the existing PAX file support added in NX 6.0.3, see Storing template PAX files in Teamcenter.
Where do I find it?
Manufacturing setup templates:
Product
NX
Application
Manufacturing
Prerequisite
Teamcenter 8.0.1 or later
NX 7.5 or later
Menu
File→New→Manufacturing tab
Start→Manufacturing
Location in dialog box
New dialog box→Templates group
Manufacturing operation templates:
Product
NX
Application
Manufacturing
Prerequisite
Teamcenter 8.0.1 or later
NX 7.5 or later
Command
Create Operation
Location in dialog box
Create Operation dialog box→Type group

-u=<username>
Specifies the NX Manager user name. (Required)
—p=<password>
Specifies the NX Manager password. (Required)
—a= overwrite | new_revision
Specifies whether to overwrite the templates or create new revisions. new_revision is the default.
—m[fkeys]=
Specifies the multi-field key support required for the MENCMachining type. The default setting is NONE.
<mfk_key_label>=<mfk_key_value>[,<mfk_key_label>=<mfk_key_value>]
Specifies the multi-field keys. In a multi-field key domain, object_type is always the key level.
NOKEY
Specifies that there are no extra keys for the type, even though the type is in a multi-field key domain.
NONE
Specifies that the MENCMachining type is not in a multi-field key domain.
-i[temfkkeys]
Specifies the multi-field key support required for the Item type. The default setting is NONE.
<mfk_key_label>=<mfk_key_value>[,<mfk_key_label>=<mfk_key_value>]
Specifies the multi-field keys. In a multi-field key domain, object_type is always the key level.
NOKEY
Specifies that there are no extra keys for the Item type, even though the type is in a multi-field key domain.
NONE
Specifies that the Item type is not in a multi-field key domain.
-pax[opt]
Generates new nxdm_ugs_manufacturing_templates.pax and cam_teamcenter_general.opt files.
When this option is set, you must make sure that you have permissions to overwrite the nxdm_ugs_manufacturing_templates.pax and cam_teamcenter_general.opt files.
-h[elp]
Prints the help message.
Example with defaults
The following example does not specify new options. The utility uses the default values to import the CAM setup templates.
%UGII_BASE_DIR%\ugii\templates\sample\tcin_cam_template_setup.bat –u=infodba –p=infodba
Example with no multi-field keys
The following example sets the multi-field keys for the MENCMachining and Item types to None. The results are the same as in the previous example.
%UGII_BASE_DIR%\ugii\templates\sample\tcin_cam_template_setup.bat –u=infodba –p=infodba –m=NONE –i=NONE
Example with one multi-field key that overwrites the pax files
In the following example, when the utility imports the CAM setup templates, the MENCMachining type has no extra keys. The Item type has one multi-field key. The mfk_key_label parameter is set to object_desc, and the mfk_key_value parameter is set to Target.
The utility overwrites the following files:
nxdm_ugs_manufacturing_templates.pax file in the %UGII_BASE_DIR%\ugii\templates folder
cam_teamcenter_general.opt file in the %UGII_CAM_BASE_DIR%\resource\template_set folder
%UGII_BASE_DIR%\ugii\templates\sample\tcin_cam_template_setup.bat –u=infodba –p=infodba –m=NOKEY –i=object_desc=Target —pax

You can use the NX Manufacturing View Maker to create and edit 3D views and the related information. After creating the 3D views, you need to set the sequence for the shop floor operator to view them. You can create manufacturing views from scratch. You do not need to clone a manufacturing view to create them. For more information, see Detailed Planning→(Optional) Create and adjust electronic drawings→Create manufacturing views or Open the NX Manufacturing View Maker in the Next Generation Planning User Assistance 6.2 or later online help under Teamcenter.
